Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand both parts of the question identifying violations of normative rules strict rules and checking desiderata recommended practices Lets start with each case provided

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1 Looking at Case 1s timeline Application Received at 0900 Then Credit Check at 0930 Thats fine sequence followed Risk Assessment next at 1000 Still in order Loan Decision Approved at 1100 Correct after risk assessment Inform Applicant at 1300 After decision okay Finalize Documentation at 1330 Since approved this is allowed before closing Close Case at 1400 All steps followed properly here So no issues with Case 1 It adheres strictly to the sequence and doesnt skip any steps or do anything contradictory

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Now Case 2 Application Received on 20240111 0800 Then Risk Assessment at 0820 Wait thats immediately after receiving the application But according to normative rules Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Here they did Risk Assessment first without a prior credit check Thats a clear violation of the sequence rule The entry says No prior Credit Check violates normative which is correct

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Then at 0900 Credit Check is done But since risk assessment already happened earlier 0820 before the credit check thats another violation So first error here is outofsequence Risk Assessment without Credit Check

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Next steps Loan Decision Rejected at 0930 After risk assessment and prior activities Now upon rejection per normative rules finalizing documentation isnt allowed But in this case they did Finalize Documentation after the decision Thats a second violation So two issues here incorrect sequence Risk before Credit and doing finalize postrejection

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Then Close Case at 1030 Even though they closed without following approval steps but since its rejected thats correct per rules However they had prior violations in process

Name: Deductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Case 3 Case 3 Application Received on 0900 Then Credit Check happens on 20240114 at 1000 Thats 13 days and 10 hours later

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait from January 12 to January 14 is two days From midnight on Jan 12 to midnight on Jan 14 is 48 hours But the credit check occurs on the 14th at 1000 AM which is more than 24 hours after application Jan 12 0900 So this violates the desideratum timing recommendation of a credit check within 24 hours

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Next steps Risk Assessment at 1100 AM same day Still within the same day but not sure about days count here Wait January 14 is two days after Jan 12 No Application received on Jan 12 so application timestamp is 0900 Jan 12 Credit check is next day Jan 13 date wait no looking at Event Log Wait the Case ID 3 has entries up to Jan 17 Let me recheck

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3s events Application Received on 20240112 0900 Then next event is Credit Check on 20240114 1000 So thats three days later From January 12 noon to January 14 noon is two full days but the credit check happens at 10 AM on Jan 14 which is more than 24 hours after application Jan 12 0900 Therefore violates the desideratum timing for Credit Check within 24 hours

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then Risk Assessment and Loan Decision all happen same day as credit check Then Inform Applicant on January 16 1500 The loan decision was at 1200 PM Jan 14 Adding from Jan 14 noon to Jan 16 noon is two days so informing the applicant more than 48 hours later violates the desideratum promptness for informing

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Loan Decision Approved followed by Finalize Documentation on Jan 17 0900 and Close Case at 1000 AM same day So no followup call which is a desideratum recommendation but not required But since its encouraged but not strict missing it isnt a violation of the rules but just suboptimal

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So summarizing violations Normative Violations Strict Rules Case 2 Two main issues 1 Risk Assessment performed before Credit Check violating the sequence where Credit Check must precede Risk Assessment 2 After Loan Decision was Rejected at 0900 they proceeded to Finalize Documentation at 1000 which is not allowed as per rules finalization only if approved Desiderata Violations Suboptimal but Not Severe Case 3 1 Credit Check occurred more than 24 hours after application receipt 2 Applicant was informed over 48 hours after the loan decision 3 No Followup Call was made before closing which is recommended but not required

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Possible Interpretations Justifications In Case 2 maybe there was an error in logging the sequence Perhaps Risk Assessment was intended first but that would still violate the normative rules unless theres a misunderstanding of requirements But according to the given constraints Credit Check must precede Risk Assessment unconditionally So even if they thought otherwise its a violation For Case 3s timing The delay in credit check might be due to extenuating circumstances like applicant not available but thats beyond process control and still a suboptimal choice Missing followup call could be an oversight or considered unnecessary by the team even though recommended
